news.title: Two New York cats tested positive for coronavirus. Here’s what you need to know about the virus and animals.

news.title: Il coronavirus tra le scimmie - Il Post

news.title: How safe are pets from Covid-19? Finding the answer to that raises more questions
news.summary: Sometimes a virus can be deadlier to another species than it is to us — just as SARS-CoV2 is likely deadlier to us than to the animal it came from.

news.title: “Il Covid-19 e l’estinzione degli scimpanzé: un’ipotesi possibile”
news.summary: Se il Covid-19 ha dimostrato tutta la sua pericolosit per l’uomo –con 9,2 milioni di contagiati e oltre 474mila morti in tutto il mondo –, potrebbe essere micidiale per altri primati portandoli all’estinzione.

news.title: Everything we know—and don’t know—about human-to-animal COVID transmission
news.summary: We think we know about the initial transmission of the coronavirus; it occurred at a live animal market in Wuhan, China, most likely from a bat to a person.

facebook.summary:
"Here, we show that all apes, including chimpanzees, bonobos, gorillas, and orangutans, and all African and Asian monkeys (catarrhines), exhibit the same set of twelve key amino acid residues as human ACE2."
